alert.note: Alert for NW Blount; North Sevier; Sevier Smoky Mountains (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 2:33PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN BLOUNT AND WESTERN SEVIER COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 332 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Sevierville, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Sevierville, Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, McMahan, Wears Valley, Harrisburg, Elkmont, Roundtop Mountain State Park, Seymour, and Kodak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Morristown.

area.areaDesc: NW Blount; North Sevier; Sevier Smoky Mountains
